    • Constructor Detail

      • Payroll

        public Payroll()
        This constructor does not set any values.

      • Payroll

        public Payroll(java.lang.String name,
               int numberID)
        throws InvalidEmployeeName,
               InvalidEmployeeNumberID
        This constructor sets the employee name and ID number to the values passed as arguments.
        Parameters:
        name - The employee's name.
        numberID - The employee's ID number.
        Throws:
        InvalidEmployeeName - Empty string for employee name passed as argument.
        InvalidEmployeeNumberID - Negative integer for employee ID number passed as argument

      • Payroll

        public Payroll(java.lang.String name,
               double numberID)
        throws InvalidEmployeeName,
               InvalidEmployeeNumberID
        This constructor sets the employee name and ID number to the values passed as arguments. This always throws an exception as an ID number cannot be a double.
        Parameters:
        name - The employee's name.
        numberID - The employee's ID number.
        Throws:
        InvalidEmployeeName - Empty string for employee name passed as argument.
        InvalidEmployeeNumberID - Non-integer integer for employee ID number passed as argument.

        Parameters:

        Throws:
        InvalidHourlyPayRate - The hourly pay rate exceeds 25 $/Hour.

      • getHoursWorkedInWeek

                          throws InvalidHoursWorkedInWeek
        Parameters:
        hoursWorkedInWeek - The hours worked in the week by the employee to set.
        Throws:
